data.title: Magnificent Historical Site
data.text: A place of peace and solitude. It's like stepping into another world when you enter the beautifully manicured grounds and walk the peaceful paths that surround the structure. A must-see in St. George.

data.title: A beautiful place to visit.
data.text: A very informative Visitor's Center. We enjoyed the films and displays. The workers there were friendly and willing to answer questions.

data.title: There is a Visitor Center where everyone is welcome!
data.text: Temples are literally houses of the Lord. They are holy places of worship where individuals make sacred covenants with God. Because making covenants with God is such a solemn responsibility, individuals cannot enter the temple to receive their endowments or be sealed in marriage for eternity until they have fully prepared themselves and been members of the Church for at least a year. Throughout history, the Lord has commanded His people to build temples. The Church is working to build temples all over the world to make temple blessings more available for a greater number of Heavenly Father's children.

data.title: Beautiful building, beautiful grounds.
data.text: This is an example of the early temples built to serve the pioneer Mormons in this part of southern Utah and northern Arizona.  We are not LDS so did not stop but merely drove around the streets bordering the temple.  There were preparations for several weddings going on outside the doors.  The building itself is quite beautiful in its pristine shining white exterior.  The grounds likewise are well maintained and beautiful.  If you have time, do stop by and take a look inside the visitors' center.

data.title: Interesting and Historic site
data.text:
Took the visiting family to see what all was there.. nice museum of the history of the
Mormon migration and settling of the Utah area. Interesting even if you're not Mormon.
Very friendly people (was not surprised), and informative visit, and the grounds are, of
course, spotless. Can see this temple from my picture window all day, and beautiful at
night , all lighted up. Well done.

data.title: Beautful vintage building
data.text: This is a beautiful building! It's calm and quiet, and nice to walk around the grounds as well. Variety of plants on grounds.

data.title: Beautiful and peaceful place
data.text: located in the old part of town, if you haven't been there, it is a must see! Take an hour of your day and go visit the grounds sit and admire the architecture or take a tour of the visitor center... You won't be disappointed..  Lots of history.

data.title: Photo Ops Are Many
data.text: The grounds around this Temple are beautiful.  The visitor centre certainly provides you with great information and the opportunities you have to sit and enjoy in their gardens are wonderful.  Really should be a stop on your agenda!

data.title: I Guess We Missed Something...
data.text:
After reading reviews we were more than a bit confused when we went here.
First let me say the building and the grounds are beautiful. 
The confusion arose because there are no tours even though the signs say there are. When we entered the visitor center we were greeted by a very nice gentleman that explained that tours aren’t available and why. The visitor center is very nicely appointed. We walked through and read what was available about the history of the Temple and the area.
If you go for the outside of the building and the grounds you will enjoy your visit. 
Do not expect a tour of the interior. Perhaps it might be different if you are Mormon.

data.title: Insperational
data.text: We gave gone here several times...Loved it each time.. This time we went to tuachan for a play...It was wonderful

data.title: Spent a day at the Visitor Center learning about Jesus Christ.
data.text: The grounds around the Temple was immaculately manicured. There was an inner peace we all felt as we roamed around the grounds. We spent some time in the Visitor Center, and there was a Christos statue that was incredible. We also spent some time watching movies and learning.

data.title: Best place in town to find peace 😊
data.text: Such a peaceful place, whether you are inside as a member of the LDS church or on the grounds enjoying the lawn and trees. A favorite spot for focusing on the important things.

data.title: Great Place to Visit
data.text: We love going to the temple grounds to feel the peace that is found there.  The guides are very friendly and helpful.  Not pushy.

data.title: Beautiful white historic temple
data.text: The St. George temple was the first temple Mormon pioneers finished in the west. It is a very bright white temple and very beautiful. You can only look at the outside unless you have a temple recommend from The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter Day Saints. There is a very nice visitors center with displays, movies and the history of the building and area. You can walk around the grounds and take photos. There is a very nice feeling here.

data.title: A Beautiful Temple
data.text: Very disappointing that if you are not a Mormon you cannot see the inside. The girls who did our tour at the visitor center were nice and very polite. Not too pushy with the Mormon information but I did have some interesting discussion with one of them. They show you pictures of the inside. "It's not secret, it's sacred".....

data.title: A must see on your visiting to St. George
data.text: I had read quite a bit about this temple before our visit. Just standing in front and walked all around and see the workmanship of this was a great sight for me. The elder at the visiting center was excellent in telling us a little bit more than what I had already read. I was very glad we spent the time before heading out to see the great 5 National Parks of the great state of Utah.

data.title: Pretty
data.text: I walked by here and decided to look inside. The outside was very pretty. It had some benches that you could sit on that were surrounded by trees. It kind of reminded me of a university.

data.title: ST GEORGE UTAH LOVE IT
data.text: love this area and this temple so beautiful.  Southern Utah is one of my favorite area's in Utah would love to have a vacation home here

data.title: Beautiful and peaceful
data.text: In the midst of all the red rock of Utah's Dixie, the temple's brilliant white exterior really stands out. The grounds are a wonderful little oasis in the midst of the desert scrub. The folks at the Visitor's Center were warm and friendly as well!

data.title: Beautiful!
data.text: Had family being sealed in marriage at the temple. The grounds are absolutely stunning, easy to sit and reflect.....
